DOC.brief_title: Sutureless Cryopreserved Amniotic Membrane Graft ( ProKera ) Wound Healing After Photorefractive Keratectomy
DOC.criteria: Active duty US Army Soldiers eligible care WRAMC . Male female , race , least 21 year old time preoperative examination , sign informed consent . The low age limit 21 year intend ensure documentation refractive stability . Subject must expect locate great Washington DC area 12 month period postoperatively . Consent subject 's command ( active duty ) participate study . Access transportation meet followup requirement . Any reason exclude PRK . Female subject pregnant , breastfeed intend become pregnant study . Female subject give urine pregnancy test prior participate study rule pregnancy . [ Pregnancy breastfeed contraindication refractive surgery general , include PRK , whether participate study ] . Patients know sensitivity inappropriate responsiveness medication use postoperative course . Any physical mental impairment would preclude participation examination . Anterior basement membrane dystrophy . History recurrent epithelial erosion . Significant dry eye ( symptomatic Schirmer test < 5 mm 5 minute ) . Other corneal epithelial disorder heal abnormality . Patients unusually tight eyelid close eyeball make difficult and/ painful insert anything ( e.g. , ProKera ) eyelid globe .
